page.title: 01Tarland and area to east
page.content: The area is generally low lying 150 to 200 metres agricultural land with the village of Tarland in the west and the lower slopes of some of the surrounding hills in the east. Most of the land is intensively farmed in large units most of which are part of the Macrobert Estates. Although cereal production, barley and wheat, is important, dairy and beef cattle as well as sheep are extensively reared. Trees have been planted in some of the less well drained area and as shelter belts. Tarland village services the rural area that surrounds it by providing basic shopping, facilities, a selction of tradesman, banks, primary schools, and a church. The population is very much an ageing one with a markedly diminishing school roll Employment
